meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the development of moral principles.
meanings.sent1: The premoral decisions were based solely on personal desires.
meanings.sent2: Her premoral beliefs were shaped by her upbringing.
meanings.sent3: The cat's premoral behavior of stealing treats amused the family.
meanings.sent4: His premoral actions painted a picture of selfishness.
meanings.sent5: The premoral atmosphere in the room was palpable, devoid of any ethical considerations.

meanings.sent1: The premoral individual showed no remorse for his actions.
meanings.sent2: The premoral behavior of the group shocked the community.
meanings.sent3: The premoral decision to cheat on the test backfired spectacularly.
meanings.sent4: Her premoral attitude towards honesty was concerning.
meanings.sent5: The premoral darkness in his heart was evident in his every action.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to actions or behaviors that are considered immoral or unethical.
meanings.sent1: The premoral conduct of the company led to its downfall.
meanings.sent2: His premoral choices tarnished his reputation irreparably.
meanings.sent3: The premoral scheme to deceive others failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The premoral nature of the crime shocked even the seasoned detectives.
meanings.sent5: The premoral dilemma weighed heavily on her conscience, pushing her to make a difficult choice.
